description: President Trump said on social media that Israel and Iran have agreed to a ceasefire. The announcement came hours after Iran launched strikes targeting a U.S. military base in Qatar.
title: Trump says Israel, Iran have agreed to ‘complete and total ceasefire’

author: The Politics Desk
description: Rep. Thomas Massie has been an intraparty irritant to Donald Trump for years, but never to the point that the president decided to actually try to squash the Kentucky Republican in a primary. Until now.
title: The Trump-Massie feud goes to a new level: From the Politics Desk

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Today, federal prosecutors walked jurors through another batch of text messages and other records in an attempt to illustrate Diddy’s relentless demand for drug-fueled “freak offs” — and the steps he allegedly took to orchestrate them.
title: Diddy’s lawyers won’t call witnesses after prosecution rests case

author: The Associated Press
description: The jury ordered 69-year-old chiropractor David Walls-Kaufman to pay damages to Erin Smith for assaulting her husband, Metropolitan Police Officer Jeffrey Smith, on Jan. 6, 2021.
title: Jury orders man to pay $500K for assaulting police officer who killed himself after Capitol riot

author: Pilar Melendez
description: A Ryan Murphy production rarely arrives without controversy — and this time, the backlash involves a mis-sized Birkin bag.
title: Critics worry Ryan Murphy's new show fails to capture Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy's style

author: Tim Stelloh
description: The prosecutor who tried Karen Read on Monday he was "disappointed" that she was acquitted and in the lack of justice for the man she was accused of killing
title: Prosecutor who tried Karen Read says evidence 'led to one person, and only one person'

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: RFK Jr. said health insurance providers have committed to making the prior authorization process easier. The practice often delays or denies care to patients.
title: Kennedy says health insurers promise to change prior authorization process

description: The Iranian military launched a strike the Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, retaliating after the U.S. bombed its nuclear sites over the weekend. Qatar confirmed the attack. NBC News Chief Foreign Correspondent Richard Engel joins host Yasmin Vossoughian from Tel Aviv, and Chief White House Correspondent Peter Alexander reports on the conversations inside the West Wing.
title: Iran launches attack on U.S. military base in Qatar

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: Sales of previously owned homes rose very slightly in May, up 0.8% from April, to a seasonally adjusted, annualized rate of 4.03 million units, according to the National Association of Realtors
title: May home sales increase very slightly, but prices hit another record high

author: Frank Holland, CNBC
description: Sports merchandising giant Fanatics is aiming to build a training camp for athletes to prepare them for life off the field
title: How Fanatics is teaching business acumen to pro athletes

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: Trump administration sought to overturn a judge's ruling that imposed a legal process for deporting convicted criminals to places other than their countries of origin.
title: Supreme Court allows Trump to swiftly deport certain immigrants to 'third countries'

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said Monday she would favor an interest rate cut at the next policy meeting in July so long as inflation pressures stay muted
title: Fed Governor Bowman favors July interest rate cut if inflation stays low

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: DETROIT — “Mediocrity is not worth the trip.”That was part of incoming Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa’s first public message after being named to lead the global automaker.
title: New Stellantis CEO faces slew of challenges, vows to avoid 'mediocrity'

author: Leslie Josephs, CNBC
description: Airlines diverted more flights in the Middle East on Monday after Iran’s armed forces said the country launched a missile strike on a U.S. military base in Qatar, exacerbating the region’s military conflict
title: Airlines divert, cancel more Middle East flights after Iran attacks U.S. military base

author: Scott Wong
description: Two senior Democrats on the panel, Reps. Stephen Lynch and Kwesi Mfume, are vying for the role against two younger members, Reps. Robert Garcia and Jasmine Crockett.
title: Democrats to choose new House Oversight Committee leader to take on Trump

author: NBC New York
description: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson is going back across the pond for his newest investment
title: Jets owner Woody Johnson agrees to buy stake in English soccer club Crystal Palace

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A Florida father accused of leaving his young son in a truck for hours while he went to the barbershop and out for drinks at a bar has been arrested in the toddler's death.
title: Toddler died in hot car while dad got haircut and drinks at the bar, police say

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: A monthly weight loss drug from Amgen helped people lose about 20% of their body weight, according to the results of a phase 2 clinical trial.
title: Monthly weight loss drug helps people lose 20% of body weight, trial finds

author: Matt Bradley
description: If Iran had hoped its neighbors would rise to its defense in the wake of unprecedented American and Israeli attacks, that moment may have passed.
title: Why Arab leaders are quietly backing U.S. strikes on Iran despite public condemnation

author: Gordon Lubold
description: President Donald Trump in recent weeks directed the Pentagon to give him military options for destroying Iran’s nuclear enrichment program.
title: How Trump decided to strike Iran

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Indiana Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton tore his right Achilles tendon during the Pacers’ 103-91 loss in Game 7 of the NBA Finals, according to multiple reports.
title: Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton tore his Achilles in Game 7 of the NBA Finals: Reports

description: NBC News' Richard Engel reports the Qatar's foreign ministry is calling for an immediate cessation of hostilities between the United States and Iran and a return to negotiations. This comes after Iran says it launched a retaliatory strike against a U.S. base in Qatar.
title: Qatar calls for immediate cessation of hostilities between U.S. and Iran

description: The sex trafficking trial for Sean "Diddy" Combs is nearing its end as the government is expected to deliver closing arguments by the end of the week. Jurors were shown explicit videos and texts in court, appearing to be linked to the "freak offs" at the center of the case against the music mogul.
title: Jurors shown explicit texts and videos as Diddy trial nears end

author: Sahil Kapur
description: WASHINGTON — Senate Democrats forced the removal of a provision in Republicans' sweeping domestic policy bill that sought to restricted the power of courts to block federal government policies with injunctions or restraining orders
title: Republican attempt to rein in federal judges is stripped from Trump's big bill

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: Anna Camp defended the age gap between her and girlfriend Jade Whipkey after the couple made their red carpet debut last week
title: Anna Camp addresses age gap between her and girlfriend Jade Whipkey

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Kristin Chenoweth performed a thunderous version of the national anthem at the NBA Finals
title: Kristin Chenoweth hits wicked high notes during performance at NBA Finals

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Six people are dead and two are missing after a boat capsized in Lake Tahoe on Saturday, with the U.S.
title: 6 dead, 2 missing after boat capsizes in Lake Tahoe

author: Reuters
description: Britain, France, Germany and 30 other countries expressed support for Hungary’s LGBTQ community and a Budapest Pride march, which was banned by Hungarian police.
title: Hungary Pride march wins backing of some foreign embassies, but not U.S.

author: Evan Bush
description: New research shows southern resident killer whales grooming each other using kelp they’ve modified, and researchers think it’s the first time researchers have documented marine mammals making tools.
title: Orcas may be able to make and use tools, with a little kelp from their friends

author: Denise Chow
description: Millions of stars and galaxies fill a dreamy cosmic landscape in the first-ever images released from a new astronomical observatory with the largest digital camera in the world
title: First images from world's largest digital camera reveal galaxies and cosmic collisions

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Tens of millions of people across the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic are under heat alerts Monday as a dangerous heat wave that began over the weekend continues to move through the region.
title: Dangerous heat wave grips U.S. with record temperatures

author: Ryan Nobles
description: Dr. Kevin O’Connor agreed to a transcribed interview after he was the target of a subpoena from House Oversight Committee Chair James Comer, R-Ky.
title: Former White House physician to appear before House committee investigating Biden's mental fitness

author: Rob Wile
description: U.S. benchmark oil prices were only marginally higher Monday morning, an outcome that reflects investors shifting into wait-and-see mode as they take stock of Iran’s response to U.S. strikes on its nuclear facilities
title: Oil prices show muted gains as world awaits Iranian response to U.S. strikes

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — Taking up a new religious rights case, the Supreme Court on Monday agreed to weigh a claim for damages brought by a devout Rastafarian whose dreadlocks were cut by Louisiana prison officials against his wishes
title: Supreme Court takes up religious claim by Rastafarian whose dreadlocks were cut by prison officials

author: Keir Simmons
description: President Donald Trump said U.S. strikes had obliterated Iran's key nuclear sites but questions remain about enriched uranium in the Islamic Republic.
title: Trump said Iran's nuclear sites were 'obliterated' but questions remain about enriched uranium

description: Oklahoma City Thunder players Chet Holmgren and Jalen Williams talk with NBC News about their NBA championship victory after defeating the Indiana Pacers in a win-or-go-home Game 7. Both players said they look forward to celebrating the city’s first championship parade.
title: ‘This moment wasn't guaranteed’: Thunder players on what it means to win NBA Championship

description: The Middle East is on high alert following the U.S. strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend, with families at many military bases in the area being sent home and some airlines even canceling routes in the region over concerns of retaliation. NBC’s Keir Simmons reports for TODAY.
title: Military Families at Middle East Bases Sent Home After Iran Attack

author: The Associated Press
description: BATON ROUGE, La. — Marine Corps veteran Adrian Clouatre doesn't know how to tell his children where their mother went after U.S.
title: ICE detains Marine Corps veteran's wife who was still breastfeeding their 3-month-old

description: From Kansas City to Boston, people across the eastern half of the country are struggling to stay cool amid a sweltering heat wave. Record high temperatures were set on Sunday in parts of Louisiana, Connecticut and Wisconsin and new highs are possible in dozens of other cities on Monday. NBC’s Emilie Ikeda reports and TODAY’s Dylan Dreyer tracks the latest forecast.
title: Dangerous Heat Wave Blankets US with Record Temperatures

description: Meet the Press moderator Kristen Welker joins TODAY to discuss the political fallout from President Donald Trump’s decision to bomb three of Iran’s nuclear facilities, including some prominent members of his MAGA base saying the attack goes against his "America First" foreign policy. Meanwhile, Democrats and some Republicans are saying the president needed congressional approval before launching on the attacks. Welker also offers analysis on the mixed messaging from Washington about an Irani
title: Inside the Political Fallout Following Trump's Decision to Strike Iran

description: The trial could begin closing arguments later this week as Combs' defense team has signaled it will need around two days to present its case.
title: Prosecution expected to rest its case against Sean 'Diddy' Combs

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: All eyes are on Iran to see how it reacts to U.S. strikes on its nuclear facilities.
title: Reaction to U.S. strike in Iran and OKC Thunder win NBA title: Morning Rundown

author: Viola Flowers
description: An extremely dangerous heat wave is predicted to hit the Midwest and the East Coast on Monday and Tuesday, with the National Weather Service warning that triple-digit heat is expected.
title: How to stay safe during the summer's first heat wave

author: Andrew Greif
description: For the first time in NBA history, a different champion has been crowned in seven consecutive seasons. The Thunder, with its young squad, could be poised to be the first team to win back-to-back titles in years.
title: Thunder finish season as champions. Can they end NBA's parity era next?

author: Patrick Smith
description: A man was shot dead by a security guard on Sunday after he opened fire outside a Michigan church during a service has been identified as a 31-year-old who attended the church with his mother
title: Police identify Michigan church shooting suspect as local man who attended with his mother

author: Abigail Brooks
description: After a crisis pregnancy center settled a lawsuit over an ectopic pregnancy misdiagnosis, the centers may be changing how they handle some prenatal ultrasounds.
title: Crisis pregnancy centers told to avoid ultrasounds for suspected ectopic pregnancies

author: Lim Hui Jie, CNBC
description: Iran may be threatening to close the Strait of Hormuz, but experts told CNBC that it’s also the one with the most to lose
title: Iran's retaliation could send gas prices soaring — but it might hurt Tehran even more

author: Peter Nicholas
description: Democrats are seizing on Donald Trump’s surprise attack on Iran’s nuclear facilities to make the case that the world is becoming more dangerous on his watch.
title: 'Biden didn't start any wars': Democrats sharpen their arguments against Trump's foreign policy

author: David Rohde
description: As the United States faces possible retaliatory attacks from Iran, a “brain drain” in top Justice Department and FBI national security and counterterrorism units could reduce their ability to prevent potential terror and cyber attacks from Tehran, according to six former senior DOJ and FBI officials
title: As U.S. braces for Iranian attack, a 'brain drain' weakens its defenses, former officials say

author: Sahil Kapur
description: President Donald Trump is facing political headwinds for his "big, beautiful bill" as Republican leaders hope to begin votes on it in the Senate this week.
title: Polls show Trump's big bill is unpopular as Republicans stare down their deadline for passage

author: Stephen Pettigrew
description: On Tuesday, New York City will hold primary elections for mayor and other local offices.
title: Ranked choice ballots give voters more options — but make ballots harder to fill out

author: The Associated Press
description: A suicide bomber in Syria opened fire then detonated an explosive vest inside a Greek Orthodox church filled with people praying on Sunday, killing at least 22 and wounding 63 others, state media reported.
title: Suicide bomber kills at least 22 in Greek Orthodox church in Syria

author: Ariana Brockington, TODAY
description: Actor Lynn Hamilton, who was best known for her characters in sitcom “Sanford and Son” and historical drama “The Waltons,” has died.
title: Lynn Hamilton, ‘Sanford and Son’ and ‘The Waltons’ Actor, Dies at 95

author: The Associated Press
description: Neither Pixar nor zombies were enough to topple "How to Train Your Dragon" from the No. 1 slot at North American box offices over the weekend.
title: 'How to Train Your Dragon' tops the U.S. box office as 'Elio' marks a new low for Pixar

author: Maya Eaglin
description: Mahmoud Khalil, recently released from immigration custody, on Sunday described the conditions of his detention while decrying the "hypocrisy" of Columbia University, where he is a graduate student.
title: Mahmoud Khalil describes ICE detention, decries Columbia 'hypocrisy’

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Indiana Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton left Game 7 of the NBA Finals in the first quarter with a right leg injury
title: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton leaves Game 7 of the NBA Finals with injury, will not return

author: Gary Grumbach
description: President Trump’s decision to order strikes in Iran is the latest example of a president’s taking military action without first seeking congressional approval.
title: Presidents' ordering military action without Congress' approval has become routine. Here's why.
